result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Outpatient Competency Admission Decision

Defendant James Jeremy Turner in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for James Jeremy Turner.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court has not received an update as to competency. Court orders referral to OCRP. No objection by parties. Review set. Address updated.
Review scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 08:00 am.

cc: DHS 8-16-22 em
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant James Jeremy Turner in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for James Jeremy Turner.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews competency exam report. Attorney Riniker requests that the court find him not competent at this time but that the defendant will likely regain competency. Attorney Frank heard on competency exam results. Attorney Riniker asks court to adopt recommendations in the report. Attorney Frank heard and requests an evaluation by Outpatient Restoration Program. Court heard and finds defendant currently not competent but could become competent. Will send a referral to department to determine inpatient or outpatient treatment is needed. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.

Defendant James Jeremy Turner in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for James Jeremy Turner.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim appeared in court. Attorney Frank heard on status of case and requests competency evaluation. No objection from State. Attorney Frank heard on no contact condition on bond. Court heard on no contact condition that was previously modified. Victim heard and wants no contact dropped. State does not object to no contact being dropped. Court heard and orders bond to be amended and the no contact to be lifted. Court orders competency evaluation in this case and in 22CF57. Status date set.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant James Jeremy Turner appeared in court, Attorney Anthony Pozorski appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant to go to SPD to apply for representation and return. Defendant returns and qualifies for SPD. Counsel to be assigned. Victim present and heard on no contact. State heard. Court modifies bond condition: Defendant may reside with victim. Defendant shall not have physical contact with victim. Defendant shall not have loud or boisterous verbal contact with victim. Arraignment continued.
DEFENDANT MAY RESIDE WITH L.A. DEFENDANT SHALL NOT HAVE ANY PHYSICAL CONTACT WITH L.A. DEFENDANT SHALL NOT HAVE ANY LOUD OR BOISTEROUS CONTACT WITH L.A.
Arraignment on March 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Arraignment on March 7, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant James Turner appears in custody by video, from Grant County Jail. Attorney Lisa Riniker appears for the State. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests a signature bond with a condition not to have contact with Victim. Defendant heard. Court sets a $500 signature bond with condition not to have contact with Victim. Arraignment date set.
Defendant shall have no contact with alleged victim L.A.
